summary: Wendy S. Collins was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCAS). She is listed in payroll and certification reports from April, August, and December of 1978. These documents provide her name, and in some cases, her social security number, annual salary, and gross pay for the specified periods. The documents indicate her employment with the committee during the period when it was actively investigating the JFK assassination.
significance: Wendy S. Collins' significance lies in her employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations during its investigation into the JFK assassination. While the documents do not specify her role within the committee, her presence on payroll and certification reports indicates she was a staff member involved in the committee's operations.
